questions.questionText: From a Bash shell, which of the following commands directly execute the instructions from the file /usr/local/bin/runme.shi without starting a subshell?
Which of the following commands can be used to determine how long the system has been running?
Which wildcards will match the following filenames? ttyS0 ttyS1 ttyS2
Instead of supplying an explicit device in /etc/fstab for mounting, what other options may be used to identify the intended partition?
Which of the following files are found in the /boot/ filesystem?

options.text: C. systemd target and service units

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are correct about the initial RAM disk involved in the boot process of Linux?

options.text: A. An initramfs is a compressed file system archive, which can be unpacked to examine its contents.
B. An initramfs file contains the MBR, the bootloader and the Linux kernel.
C. After a successful boot, the initramfs contents are available in /run/initramfs/.
D. The kernel uses the initramfs temporarily before accessing the real root file system.
E. An initramfs does not depend on a specific kernel version and is not changed after the initial installation

questions.questionText: Which of the following commands are valid in the GRUB 2 configuration file?
Given the following two symbolic links in a System V init configuration: /etc/rc1.d/K01apache2 /etc/rc2.d/S02apache2 When are the scripts executed that are referenced by these links?

options.text: A. S02apache2 is run when runlevel 2 is entered.
B. S02apache2 is run when runlevel 2 is left.
C. K01apache2 is never run because K indicates a deactivated service.
D. Both S02apache2 and K01apache2 are run during a system shutdown.
E. K01apache2 is run when runlevel 1 is entered.
